sen.j: 波多野 秀治（はたの ひではる）は、丹波国の戦国大名。
sen.e: Hideharu HATANO was a Daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) of Tanba Province in the Sengoku period.
Hideharu HATANO was a Daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) of Tanba Province in the Sengoku period.

sen.j: 波多野氏最後の当主である。
sen.e: He was the last head of the Hatano clan.
He was the last head of the Hatano clan.
He was the last head of the Hatano clan.

sen.j: 天文10年（1541年）、波多野晴通の子として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as a son of Harumichi HATANO in 1541.
He was born as a son of Harumichi HATANO in 1541.

sen.j: 晴通は波多野氏本家の当主であり、秀治はその後を相続したはずと考えられるのだが、なぜか一族の伯父である波多野元秀の養子となった上で家督を継いでいる。
sen.e: Harumichi was the head of the main Hatano clan and Hideharu should have simply taken it over, but somehow Hideharu became an adopted child of his uncle Motohide HATANO then took over his father's position.

Harumichi was the head of the main Hatano clan and Hideharu should have simply taken it over, but somehow Hideharu became an adopted child of his uncle Motohide HATANO before taking over his father's position.

sen.e: Harumichi was the head of the main Hatano clan and Hideharu should have simply taken it over, but somehow Hideharu became an adopted child of his uncle Motohide HATANO before taking over his father's position.

sen.j: 波多野氏は秀治の祖父・波多野稙通の死後から三好長慶に服属していたため、秀治は最初は三好氏の家臣であった。
sen.e: The Hatano clan had been working for Nagayoshi (Chokei) MIYOSHI after the death of Hideharu's grandfather Tanemichi HATANO and Hideharu was at first a vassal of the Miyoshi clan.

sen.e: The Hatano clan had been working for Nagayoshi (Chokei) MIYOSHI since the death of Hideharu's grandfather Tanemichi HATANO, and Hideharu was at first a vassal of the Miyoshi clan.

sen.j: そのためか、正親町天皇の即位式のときには列席していた。
sen.e: Therefore, he attended at the enthronement ceremony of the Emperor Ogimachi.
Probably for that reason, he attended at the enthronement ceremony of the Emperor Ogimachi.

sen.e: Probably for that reason, he attended at the enthronement ceremony of the Emperor Ogimachi.

sen.j: だが、長慶死後の永禄8年（1566年）、秀治は居城の八上城を奪還し、戦国大名として独立した。
sen.e: However, after the death of Nagayoshi (Chokei) in 1566, Hideharu recaptured their headquarters Yakami-jo Castle to become independent as a Sengoku Daimyo.

sen.j: また、播磨国の別所長治を娘婿として同盟を結んでいる。
sen.e: He also formed an alliance with his adopted son-in-law Nagaharu BESSHO of Harima Province.
He also formed an alliance with his adopted son-in-law Nagaharu BESSHO of Harima Province.

sen.j: 永禄10年（1568年）、織田信長が足利義昭を奉じて上洛してくると、信長の家臣となった。
sen.e: In 1568, when Nobunaga ODA visited Kyoto under Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, Hideharu became Nobunaga's vassal.
In 1568, when Nobunaga ODA visited Kyoto to obey Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, Hideharu became Nobunaga's vassal.
sen.cmt: under → to obey に変更しました。

sen.j: 天正2年（1575年）には信長が派遣してきた明智光秀の軍勢に加わって丹波で織田氏に反抗する豪族の討伐を担当したが、天正3年（1576年）1月に突如として叛旗を翻し、光秀の軍勢を攻撃して撃退した（黒井城の戦い）。
sen.e: In 1574, Hideharu joined Mitsuhide AKECHI's army sent by Nobunaga and fought to suppress local powers who were opposed to the Oda clan in Tanba, but all of a sudden in February 1575, he changed his allegiances and attacked Mitsuhide's army and repelled them (The Battle of Kuroi-jo Castle).
sen.cmt: 天正元年が1573年ですので、天正２年は1574年、３年は1575年となると思います。

sen.j: これに激怒した信長は、光秀に命じて再度の丹波侵攻を命じた。
sen.e: Enraged Nobunaga ordered Mitsuhide to invade Tanba again.
Enraged Nobunaga ordered Mitsuhide to invade Tanba again.
Enraged Nobunaga ordered Mitsuhide to invade Tanba again.

sen.j: これに秀治は八上城で籠城して対抗、光秀の攻撃を1年半にもわたって耐え抜いた。
sen.e: Against this, Hideharu fought by barricading himself in the Yakami-jo Castle and coped with Mitsuhide's attack for over one and a half years.
Against this, Hideharu fought by barricading himself in the Yakami-jo Castle and coped with Mitsuhide's attack for over one and a half years.

sen.j: しかしながら光秀の調略で味方であったはずの丹後国・但馬国における豪族が織田氏に寝返り、さらに長期の籠城戦で兵糧も尽きてしまい、天正7年（1579年）に光秀に降伏した。
sen.e: However, with Mitsuhide's plan, local powers of Tango and Tajima Provinces who used to be on Hideharu's side turned to the Oda clan side; and with the prolonged fight from the castle and running out of army provisions, he surrendered to Mitsuhide in 1579.

sen.j: その後、秀治は弟の秀尚と共に安土城に送られたが、信長の命令で6月2日に安土の浄巌院慈恩寺で磔に処された。
sen.e: Later on, Hideharu was sent to the Azuchi Castle with his brother Hidenao but on Nobunaga's order, he was executed by crucifixion in Jion-ji Temple of Jogo-in in Azuchi on July 5.

sen.e: It happened to be the date exactly three years before the Honnoji Incident.

sen.j: 朝廷を重んじる尊王心が強かったようで、正親町天皇に対して即位の礼の費用を献上し、さらに軍を率いて京都の警護を務めている。
sen.e: He had high respect for the Imperial Court and he not only donated funds for the expenses for the ceremony of the enthronement of the Emperor Ogimachi but also provided a security service for Kyoto by leading his army.

sen.j: 圧倒的に兵力・物量・人材で劣る秀治が、信長に対して1年半以上も抵抗し続けることができた理由は、丹波の山間の地形を利用したゲリラ戦法に長けていたからである。
sen.e: The reason for Hideharu, who were crushingly weaker in force size, amount of material and human resources, could fight against Nobunaga for more than one and a half years was that he was superior at hit-and-run tactics utilizing the topography of the mountains in Tanba.

sen.j: 長期戦に苛立つ光秀が、生母（あるいは育ての母同然の叔母とも）を秀治に人質として差し出し、代わりに秀治・秀尚が降伏して開城するという条件で助命するということで籠城戦を終結させた。
sen.e: Mitsuhide, who was irritated by the prolonged battle, ended the tact of holding the castle by promising to save Hideharu and Hidenao under the condition that Mitsuhide would give his own mother (this could have been his aunt who brought him up) as a hostage to Hideharu and Hideharu and Hidenao would surrender and open the castle.
